item.title: Epsilon Nd curve vs Age
item.description: The epsilon Nd curve The epsilon Nd (\(\epsilon_{Nd}\)) is a widely used parameter to understand the processes of rock forming, i.e. petrogenetic processes from both geochemical and geochronological approach. By definition, \(\epsilon_{Nd}\) is the difference of \(^{143}Nd/^{144}Nd\) of rock sample and ‘chondritic uniform reservoir’ at the time in the past T. For a rock of age T, \(\epsilon_{Nd}(T)\) is the ‘initial’ value of \(\epsilon_{Nd}\); the value at the time of crystallization of the rock, and \(\epsilon_{Nd}(0)\) is the measured value (dePaolo, 1981).
